posts.name: Anonymous

>>52736303
A flying resist makes plenty of sense. Rock and steel types already resist it, because pecking at a hard surface isn't very good, and Flying's special moves like gust, hurricane, or other things that involve high-wind speed are the sort of thing that pokemon adapted to blizzard conditions should be able to better endure.

That said, tossing on four resists all at once is definitely overkill. Having any sort of resists would make them better able to actually switch in and do something. That's part of why Grass and Rock types often still manage to work despite having even more weaknesses than Ice.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52709826
My ebay secrets.
1. Don't bid until the last second. The app lags a few seconds behind the desktop site. You can even bid on 0 seconds in the app.
2. Keep track of what you buy. Some people claim to get nearly 100% of their cards but I had plenty of people who don't send the cards. Ebay always refunds me but it's hard to tell when you buy a lot of cards if you got them. It takes a few days so as soon as the expected delivery day arrives and you don't get the card report it as the item never arriving. Ebay gives the seller a few days to respond then you get your money.
3. Look at the images. You can gamble on poor images if you want but make sure you know what is being sold.
4A. Look at the seller rating and negative feedback. Again, you can gamble if you want but for me it's not worth it to try and save a few dollars from a new or low rating seller.
4B. Look at the seller's other items. You can see what they sell, what they have sold, and if you are interested in their other cards. If you buy multiple cards from the same seller send them a message to combine shipping.
5. I search "Pokemon", "Auctions only", sort by "ending soonest", item location "US" (I avoid international sellers if I have an option), and set number of bids from 1-100 (weeds out things nobody is interested in). The bid numbers can't be set on the app, only in advanced search on the desktop or full site but you can save it and it work on the app. After you click it twice because the first time it shows you all the new items for that search.
6. Yes, I search all "Pokemon". Some cards slip by because they don't say "Pokemon" in the title but they are few. You also get games and toys in the results but the vast majority is cards.
7. Don't let your searches get set to a specific category. There are two categories, "Toys and Hobbies" and "Collectibles", full of pokemon cards.

I have made many mistakes, bought fake cards, bought shitty lots, overpaid, all because I didn't look carefully.

posts.com: Never sold a card on ebay before, any of you have experience shipping cards? Preferred method?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52720669
Cheapo cards:
> Top loader
> Teambag
> Sandwiched in cardboard
> Envelope

Assuming it isn't a dirt cheap card (<$5). Same thing, replace envelope with bubble mailer. That'll get it where it needs to go 99% of the time without damage.

For the cards expensive enough where that 1% is important. Replace bubble mailer with small 5"x5" box, some extra packing, and make sure to tape all the seams.

>>52720669
people won’t like to hear this but i’ve sold ~30-40 cards on ebay from 2012-present day ranging from $10-$70 and i’ve only ever: put them in a sleeve, put that sleeve upside down in a top loader (to seal the card inside), sandwich that between 2 notecards, in a normal envelope, with a stamp. never been scammed, never had a complaint, never had a return.
it’s up to you to take the risk but it’s easy, convenient, ridiculously cheap, and buyers like the free shipping.
personally i find it terribly frustrating when a seller over packages the card
>in a sleeve, taped on 4 sides to a piece of cardboard, sandwiched between cardboard that is taped on 4 sides, in an envelope that is encased in packing tape
frick off, i’m more likely to damage the card freeing it from that prison

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52736517
Placing o-ring binders spine-side-up is literally the smartest way to store them. The loose leaf pages all have their openings at the top of the page, so no cards will slide out. Plus, having all the pages hang down prevents any potential for the ring to press itself into the cards, leaving a dent.

You know, the Kennyspam brings up an interesting proposition as to why Kenny is so completely taken aback by Goh being Dawn’s partner in the fanfic.
I wonder if he acknowledged that Dawn was likely to end up with Ash after his battle with him, considering she specifically said in her letter that she chose to go on to the League to cheer him on.
So with that in mind and having the nagging possibility that Dawn has likely hooked up with the boy she’s traveled around Sinnoh with, can you really blame his reaction when Dawn’s partner for the doubles contest isn’t any other coordinator, isn’t Ash because she might be his girlfriend, but some literal who he’s never, ever met before, and actually unlike Ash, has never even participated in, let alone been in a contest before?
I think it’s an interesting prospect to consider his initial reaction to Goh. Then there’s Ursula manipulating him afterwards as well to fuel the fire.

Same. Now that the initial reveal is wearing off, the concept of a timeskip and Ash having a daughter is becoming less believable from any reasonable standpoint to me. The amount of time and effort required for redesigning every major previous character in case of wanting a return, essentially making several regional professors either ancient or fucking dead (I'm looking at you, Oak and Rowan), and so forth... and then cutting off any possibility of going back to Ash if the new show totally flops... I don't see it. Placing bets on there actually being no shipfaggotry in the remaining episodes, not with Misty, Dawn, or Serena, and Liko being 10 while Ash is also 10. And I also feel like old man Yuyama doesn't actually give a shit about any of the ships, but also respects the various directors that have worked under him who have pushed their own ships over the seasons, that he's going to decide not to rock the boat and retain the status quo there.

Hey it's me again, stopping in to plug the VN I'm writing. Hang out with Cynthia in Olivine City and solve crimes! Guest appearance by Jasmine. Contains lewds. It's completely free.

https://writefuck.itch.io/olivinelights

>What's new?
I had intended Day 5/Friday to be a fairly brief epilogue to finish off the game, but it ended up more involved because of all the little things I wanted to tie up and the small variations on how the plot can play out. Day 5 is pretty much all written (including a second lewd scene with Cynthia!) but I need to finish editing/spellchecking the new scenes, clean up some lewd art, and then double check that there aren't any inescapable narrative dead ends that the game won't be able to proceed from. I'm sure I've missed something. There is also now a Day 6/Saturday but it's just one brief scene where you say goodbye and leave before the credits roll.

Anyway my goal it to have version 1.3 released on or before Christmas day. I think I'll make it?

posts.com:
>>52725067
>What is the planned final version
Oh man that's a hard question to answer definitively because I'm making this up as I go. I started writing in July, posted the first playable version in September, and intended to release monthly updates as I add things and fix bugs. The game will be "complete" as of 1.3 in the sense that the story is finished, but I have a ton of secrets and side paths that I want to add, as well as some alternate options for endings. For example right now you can go to Jasmine's computer and find some material to blackmail her with, but I haven't yet added in an option to actually blackmail her or the scenes that would follow that. So I don't really know when the game with be 100% complete.

I've also had a handful of ideas where I had to stop myself and ask if they actually fit in this VN or if they'd be better off for a sequel and/or their own story. I'm not trying to cram every little possible thing into this VN, just the things that fit with the story.

Sydney gets some boost with Sp Att this week, so someone who can reliably debuff that would be good. Also applies team wide paralysis before sync which fucks your regen. As a budget team I would try:
3* Marley Arcanine gives speed boost and can protect/cure the paralysis
Ghettsis with Glaciate spam can usually slow cheese one fight paired with a tank and some combination of speed booster, poisoner, sp def debuffer, or healer.
4* Viola Masquerain reduces the full team's Sp Att and can play special tank.

If you don't have the units for that, you might be able to experiment with 3* Janine Ariados which can poison and then debuff Sp Att and Speed every turn, or 3* Surge Electrode which can reduce Sp Att by 2 every turn.

>>52723997
If you’re putting money in this game, than getting the 20 day login packs are definitely the deal, as well as the $1 gem pack that always happens whenever we get a new Masterfair (although right now they’re gone since it’s already been like a month since Cale, and Serena were added), New Years will also have a good bundle, $8 and you get 2022 or 2023 gems.
You only really want to use paid gems on selector multis, or on a step up for a new seasonal pair that you seriously like, want, and where you really don’t have any f2p gems for them (I definitely do not recommend doing every step at all), also save paid gems for the 25 of every month so you can do the 25 gem multi. Single pulls are also good to go if it’s a with increased rates like a fair banner, and then using f2p gems to do multis a few days before it ends if you didn’t get the featured you wanted.

If you powered up Ghetsis during the Unova VA, he does fine numbers as an Ice DPS, you just need units to buff him regardless of their types. Ice has always been lacking, mainly because most of them are limited to fair and season exclusive. Same with fairy, especially fairy.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: People were talking about Trev last thread, saying that Attackers blow it up, and it's partially true. What makes Snorlax so good with Heavy Slam is that it can close the gap between itself and the backline, as well as dive its own backline to help them. Trev is a brawler, and extremely strong at that. It dishes out a ton of damage, has a ton of sustain, and has a lot of displacement and cc, but only so long as it can stay in the fight. So long as it can be kited, or there isn't a front line to fight, it isn't nearly as strong as it might be against say a Defender and an All Rounder, because without its sustain, it doesn't last all that long. It's also skill dependent, if someone ejects away you're basically out of luck, if you miss your Horn Leech you're in a shit ton of trouble, etc. It's also really easy to get away from it, as the slow on Curse is very minute. I think a nice buff would be a slightly bigger slow debuff on Curse, and a speed buff on itself. A Unite cd decrease might also help, as that can help it close gaps as well. I can see Trev being a good pick in draft when you can see what your opponents have, but when the players get a bit better than dumb as nails and teams are 80% ranged with ways to escape, it becomes harder to excel with it.

>>52735012
People blaming stacks are overseeing the issues the ranked in this game has in general.

The only restrictions for duo/trio is that they have to be either ultra or master, add ontop of this that the game tries to balance out stack size and you realize what the problem is. Imagine two trios queueing with one having two 1600 and an Ultra player, the other three 1200 - 1400: the game will then try to make the average somewhat even but the Ultra player in the 1600 stack as outlier pushes their average down fucking up the team balancing. The biggest joke about this example is that the numbers don't even reflect the players skill. 1600 only means they played enough games with a somewhat 50% winrate. It is possible that the 1200 - 1400 stack is flat out better than the other as rank means jack shit in this game.

>>52735447
Most solo players I see when playing in a stack aren't even able to do damage as damage dealer. They also don't know what it means to play as "team". If you're relying on randoms in a stack you will get disappointed. >>52707993
Nintendo cannot tell you to stop if they have nowhere to deliver the message to. If you want to distribute a file with 100% chance of no one being able to do anything, create a webserver and host it exclusively via Tor or I2P. This will, however, limit who has access to your file because most people don't want to deal with this shit. You can alternatively use anonymous file hosts, uploading to them via a VPN, and reuploading whenever they get a takedown request. If you use several file hosts, you may make it cease to be worth Nintendo's time to keep playing whack a mole.

Finally, file sharing is always an option. Be aware that any time you are hosting a file off of your own PC, you leak your IP address to all of your peers. This is the case both with bittorrent and with IPFS. However, with a sufficient number of peers, it is again very fucking annoying for Nintendo to play whack a mole. They can send you a C&D order, but then everyone else with the same torrent file is capable of seeding. Once a large enough quantity of people have the file, there is nothing they can do to prevent further distribution.

Ultimately, the two keys to being successful at evading copyright law are OPSEC and persistence. Reveal as little as possible about yourself wherever possible. If you must use a name, use a pseudonym that is not in any way connected to your real name. Don't even make it one they can find through three or four hops from a google search because you used it once when you were 8, and that was on an account that you use your current email with. Make something from scratch. Be invisible and relentless.

Happy hacking.

posts.com:
I had an idea for something to put in a romhack and was curious how people feel about it. Here's a quick mockup of UI ideas, but I was wondering how it'd feel to put in something halfway between Pokemon Snap and PLA's research objectives where you take pictures of pokemon doing certain things.

>take a picture of X pokemon
>take a picture of X pokemon getting hit by Y-type attack
>take a picture of X pokemon using a certain attack or type of attack
>take a picture of 2 X pokemon (initiate double battle)
>take a picture of a critical hit
>take a picture of X pokemon with Y status condition
>take a picture of X pokemon in Y weather condition

Stuff like that. The window to check for conditions being completed would probably be the entire turn just so that you don't have to have strict timing on short events or if you have animations turned off. Also put a hard limit on how many pictures you can take per battle and only like one per turn. Might be easier to just make it automatic. I cant' imagine that it'd be TOO hard of a feature to implement, but I am curious if anyone would even want to do it.

I personally like it because I like non-battling progression being in the games. Though you're still technically getting into battles, but you won't need to finish them. Still trying to think of what that progression would look like aside from reporting your pictures through the PC system and getting valuable items like XP candies and such so that you could still be gym ready if you spent your time photographing stuff instead.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52728193
On one hand it's good progression
On the other it's basically a big achievement system, which can be very difficult to balance to make not too grindy yet rewarding. I suppose it depends on scale - if you need to Snap every species doing those things, thats gonna be very grindy and therefore needs a BIG payoff, unless you're trying to make the game more of a collectathon.
Using it for more focused "missions" where the conditions you're trying to achieve are specific and the reward scaled appropriately isn't too bad (think something like the newspaper guy in DPPt that gives you rewards for bringing him pokemon of a specific kind).
I guess it all depends on how pervasive you want this feature to be. Another good use would be allowing the camera to provide information on the pokemon you've photographed - for example, scouting abilities or natures (gives this an excellent use in the wild), or perhaps a little card with types/weaknesses/loose statbars of stats? Could be especially nice if you're attempting to rebalance game stats at all)

Simple example here is a Ttian/Dynamax pokemon that has a stalactite as a doubles or triples partner. Upon depleting the stalactite's health, it flinches the pokemon for two turns. Really basic example, but you probably take the meaning.

What do people think?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52734096
Yes, DizzyEgg's emerald expansion did this. It's a decomp base that has everything and anything they could think to incorporate RE: raw pokemon data as of gen 8. The issue is most low-level hack makers can't code for shit, and 90% of the available GUI-driven tools are just ways to modify trainers and movepools. Combine these two issues and you get a steady stream of brainlets releasing a "hack" that's just retooling teams, moves, and abilities and MAYBE stats with MAYBE 1-2 new features coded and a couple cute scripts (almost always tied to a trainer NPC). Can't help it, the easiest path yields the common product and the undercurrent to pokemon in general is the "catch em all" ideology that means culling the dex is a sin and EVERYTHING must be present.
It's pretty tone-deaf to be honest - nobody is playing gen 3/4 hacks with the intention of seeing gen 7/8 Pokemon. But some memes like Ludlocke Platinum or Rad Red or Emerald Kaizo get clicks, and brings a fresh wave of people to the scene who just want to make EXACTLY that.
Thankfully there are some based people in the scene who produce code, provide endless useful branches, and are righteous gatekeepers with impossible disdain for these entry-level scrubs who spam posts like "can somebody code me a new weather type :))))"
It's actually super refreshing and I hope it stays as insular as it has, you have to actively try to find where these guys are AND they expect you to keep up but will help if you do the baseline work to understand the game's code.

All of the 2D animation is still hand drawn, Pokemon anime doesn't use tweening or any other kind of automatic generation. >>52729531
I tried playing ROWE and quit around the sixth gym. The plots and events are completely gutted to make the open world work. There's no sense of progress when you can surf and teleport anywhere you've been before the first gym. There's no reason to backtrack to certain locations when you can clear them on the first pass no matter what. The whole game feels samey and boring.

Starting wherever you want was kinda cool, but I ended up largely conforming to the normal gym order. Hoenn has a very clear natural progression. Starting in say Fortree is retarded because you'll hit the level cap before reaching another city. And conversely saving the short routes for last means the last gyms will be a grindfest.

Outside of the free gym order, the only things ROWE has going for it are the standard QoL changes. At that point, I'd rather play an Emerald hack that keeps the game structure in tact. At least that would feel like an actual game and not a big sandbox with nothing to do other than collect the badges.

tl;dr open world is a meme

Sneasler and Weavile both look good, it just depends on the proportions used, especially for Sneasler: their in game 3d models both look bad

pic is my autistic OCD opinions on them all, Feedback on spelling/wording, suggestions on other stuff to mention/trying to change my mind, and telling me how shit my taste is appreciated

tl;dr

>Sneasel was my favorite pokemon, I love creature/character designs with big claws/hands/forearms and with impish/jester aspects, speedy blade abilities, and I love how much of a smug piece of shit it is. The asymmetry of the ear feather looks cool too

>Weavile is still cool, especially in Gen 4/5 sprites and Pokken where his head isn't gigantic and he's got decently lengthy limbs, but the headdress isn't as cool as the single assymetric feather, and his smaller, more normal looking 3 clawed hands aren't as cool as weavile's, and he looks downright comical in the current 3d model which gives him stubby limbs and a giant head

>Sneasler retains more of what I like about Sneasel, and makes the claws even cooler, but the proportions are pretty lanky and the color scheme is a massive downgrade. The 3d model also looks even more uncanny, like with weavile. Fanart that makes the peoportions less stick figure esque and makes it less a blue and more a grey looks way better

>Shiny H-Sneasel I like about as much as Sneasel, the poison splotches look cool and the face/claws are a sidegrade, but the default colors suck shit

>Overall, Sneasel and Shiny-H-Sneasel are tied for my favorite pokemon, with Sneasler slightly behind or maybe tied when depicted in ideal circumstances, with likewise ideal Pokken/Sprite weavile very high up too, in or just under my top 10, but in their 3d models both don't make my top 10 and probably not even my top 15 or 20

>Also if Shiny H-Sneasler had a more green/lime yellow rather then a mustard, and Shiny Sneasler kept the color scheme, they'd both be 15/10 prefect

>>52717604
well to be honest it makes sense, if you look at it from a business perspective. By announcing that
>1) Ash is retiring
>2) Ash becomes a pokemon master
>3) Misty and Brock are returning
>4) A new series with Ash not as the protagonist
Then it leads to a lot of buzz and interest in something that might have been ignored otherwise, as the worse thing for something is to not be talked about and fade into obscurity. Think of it like cashing in your chips for a big payout. As you now have a lot of potential older customers who may not have been keeping up with the series now becoming interested again.

Marketing move, clearly, both for the 30-somethings that watched them as kids and everyone else who knows how central RGBY iconography is to the brand. The anime kind of cheats here. While its continuity is so light and Ash's character so often tweaked to fit the moment that it would be better described as "relaunching" every 3 years, the connective tissue is technically there, and all kinds of shows that don't dramatically acknowledge the passage of time can still call back to earlier characters or events as part of the ending. And if nothing else Ash has only seen Misty for few days time in what amounts to... six years of in-anime time? That's reason enough. The Ash of the ending is not the Ash that Pokemania children watched, no... but then he was never going to be.

Area Zero is where the Ultimate Weapon struck.
Disk is a Zygarde core transformed when it was struck by the Ultimate Weapon.
Tera energy/crystals are the remnants of the Ultimate Weapon's/Disk's energy crystallised (like mega stones).
The Time Machine is a manmade Key Stone that transformed nearby Pokemon with high tera energy (like a permanent mega evolution).
Heath's records are smaller localised incidents of the transformation.

>>52716272
>Will chesnaught at least be good in pvp?
Probably. It has Venusaur stats for the most part, with fighting-type instead of poison-type, Smack Down instead of Razor Leaf, and Superpower instead of Sludge Bomb. The lack of poison-typing and Razor Leaf might make it feel like less of a threat against things it counters, and its fighting-typing will make it more susceptible to Charmers and Wing Attackers, but the ability to constantly threaten either Frenzy Plant or Superpower will definitely give it some place in the GL and UL meta.

Should also be noted that Dragon Tail is now about as strong as Dragon Breath, with slightly better DPT in exchange for longer animations.
>ML
After MLPC in early January, there will be no more classic cups, so most players will be running lvl. 41+ Pokémon, so keep that in mind before jumping in with what you have. Dragonite is even better in this league with Superpower, Excadrill has become the dedicated low-tier fairy, dragon and steel killer, and Groudon basically needs Fire Punch to do more than charge up charge moves.

Overall meta has changed a lot, though most of the old top-tiers are still usable, if not exactly good enough to get you to legend rank.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
It was okay, but as always there was too much Kanto pandering ... There's so many interesting Pokemon a movie could've focused on, but no, it's still Mewtwo like 1998. Sure I love Mewtwo, but it felt a bit lazy.
And the Charizard, I hate that realistic design and I hate the usual special treatment it gets.

Some realistic Pokemon were nicely made (like Cubone, Lickitung, Pikachu, Psyduck, Ludicolo, Bulbasaur, Morelull, Torterra ...), but I feel most were not.
Many look too much like plushes and puppets (like Aipom, Sneasel, Pancham and Pangoro, Eevee, Snubbul and its fucked proportions ...) and Charizard is painful to look at. I personally imagine it to have less rougher skin. God, that model looks like it got a basket ball for skin.

Also a small pet peeve that I noticed, there's a scene towards the end where they copy-pasted something like 5 Sneasel in a row in the crowd in the same shot. I get that it is shown for just a couple seconds, but they had enough models at their disposal to avoid such an embarrassing mistake.

The Ditto battle was cool.

>>52724757
Export the .sav file.
Load it in the PKHex editor. Now you have all the data you need for each Pokemon.
Load up whatever game you want to transfer them to. Export the .sav file.
Load it in PKHex. Create exact copies of your pokemon, Set them into party or Box slots. Save the file.
Reload Desmume, import the new .sav file. Check to make sure it worked.

Badaaaa bing badaaaa boom

>>52725084
Get PKhex, open up your .sav file for your GBA games and at the top left click export box or click on an individual Pokemon and click export, then open your .dsv file and click import box/pokemon and it will appear.

Doing it via pkhex will keep the data too except you will in some cases find HMs will appear as a bunch of hyphens instead of their move name and location data may be scrambled to just "MYSTERY ZONE" (Pokemon Ranch) especially if it's Orre Pokemon. The HM mess happened to my shiny Linoone and a few of my Colosseum pokes had the wrong location data, otherwise they're kept as is.

Usually, HMs are automatically deleted via PKhex. Anyway, I want to start gen 5 soon, I've never picked Snivy before.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52730998
This is correct. The reason you can set an egg move on a pokemon that was wild caught is because there exists a process in game for the pokemon to get that move normally (through the mirror herb) so egg moves on wild pokemon are no longer an issue.

The latest handler is like that for you because you don't have your own save file loaded into pkhex so because you changed the TID/SID/OT from the pkhex default when you load it pkhex uses the current user (since you dont have a save loaded that is pkhex) as the last user because it does not match the currently set TID/SID/OT

>>52714969
For Enigma you need to surround a plot with 4 random berries, each in a specific direction. You get the hints from the Kanto Berry Master, which can take some time depending on your luck. The mutation chance itself is very low.

Next to Rowap are Kee and Maranga. Their mutation chances are not as low as Enigma, and the setups are simpler, just surround your target plot with a Liechi and a Ganlon (for Kee), or a Salac and a Petaya (for Maranga). I recomend you get those two first, so the berry master can only give you Enigma hints.

>>52724438
Bootstrap is just a bunch of pre-defined css classes, it has documentation about it, this game uses Bootstrap 4
Check https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/layout/grid/ to understand a bit

This is farmModal.html, what I did is add a div with the row class and add the col-8, then add another div with class col-4 for the berry data, when you use Bootstrap grid, the 100% of the container is col-12, so you can use col-8 and then another div with col-4 to get two columns taking the 100% of the container, more than 12 will move the column below

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52724545
In the col-4 div, I added
><!-- ko using: App.game.statistics.selectedBerryID() -->
To get the ID of the selected berry, then I just copypasted the content of the modal-body from the berryDexModal.html file into it
The ko using line grabs the value in App.game.statistics.selectedBerryID() and then you can use said value with $data, the modal also uses $data so you don't need to modify anything from the modal
Here's ko using documentation: https://knockoutjs.com/documentation/with-binding.html

I'm shit explaining stuff so tell me if you didn't understand something
Also, in the link that calls the modal, change the href from href="#berryDexModal" to something else so it doesn't open the modal, after you tested everything, remove anything related to the modal

>also what does href do?
href is used in html to put a clickable link, in this case, it references to the ID of the modal berryDexModal.html
>is it possible to make make it so that the column can referrence the berrydexmodal instead of copy pasting the whole thing?
You can turn it in to a template (check templates folder), but templates are mostly used if you need to use the same code in several places
I think you can also use @import too but to be honest I never used it so I don't know if there is some complexity with it, I know index.html uses it to load modals and some containers but that's it

>>52717546
Starmie is really nasty, it has a +22.5% crit rate with Bubblebeam for an effective power of 65*1.5*1.8= 175bp off of 100 Special.

In RBY criticals don't do double damage, rather it's level dependent multiplier of (2*Lv+5)/(Lv+5). That means a Level 2 Rattata on Route 1 getting a critical only hits for 1.28 times damage.
I actually kind of like that, it makes the early game much less volatile, no one hit kills on an unlucky critical. And it's not like it affect competitive much since at 50 the multiplier is 1.9 and at 100 it's 1.95.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52736376
I think it's interesting and noteworthy that out of the whole list of transfer Pokémon, every one of them is a starter, regional form/evolution, or Legendary/Mythical, except for Carbink.
Carbink is notable for being connected to Diancie, one of Kalos' three Mythicals who are all transferable. Both of them are Pokémon based off of gems, and Diancie is notably the only Mythical and Gen 6 Pokémon that had a Mega Evolution.
I'm not about to make a huge leap and go KALOS CONFIRMED or go completely insane and say Megas are coming back, but I think there has to be some significance to it. Carbink and Diancie are a strong thematic fit with Paldea's Tera Crystals and the mystery Legendary that created them. My bet would be that Diancie will be the next Mythical to get the Deoxys/Keldeo treatment.
Of course Keldeo wasn't added to SwSh until the actual DLC where you could get it, but they've clearly put a lot more thought and planning into SV's DLC, with it being set up as a direct continuation of the story addressing the big questions that were left unanswered in the postgame.

>>52736086
Hoenn had some pretty extreme environments, though it did have its desert sandwiched in a canyon next to a volcano, and the ice cavern was on the opposite side of the region in the deepest part of an island cave. It's also a region where the entire theme was weather, so extreme environments didn't need to return from it.
Sinnoh was the first introduction of proper ice routes rather than just ice caves, though Sinnoh also lacked a proper desert.
Unova has a giant desert with ancient ruins in between two rivers and two of the most major cities in the region, although there was plenty of ice due to having Winter as a season.

Kalos cemented the trend by having some desert badlands next to a swamp next to frigid mountains.

All three of the regions have an ice cave somewhere, though Shoal Cave is further out of the player's way than the Seafoam Islands or Ice Path. And of course, Cinnabar was always meant to be a volcanic island, even if the Gameboy wasn't the best at executing upon that.
Hoenn's most extreme freature compared to the two is the desert, which again, is quite justified due to the rain shadow thanks to the surrounding mountains.
>sea, deep sea, a valley, hot springs
Yes? An active volcano allows for hotsprings, and having elevation means valleys. All three regions have seas, and presumably Johto and Kanto have something under the waves other than a white void. What part of being able to dive underwater is illogical to you?

>bigger scale
All three of the games are quite restrained in scale due to the nature of their graphics, such as how Kanto's bustling urban cities are home to a few dozen people in most cases.

Your fucking mind on Hoenn. I'm talking about the scale of how everything is fucking next to each other in Hoenn, instead of just focusing on a single environment. Tropical Hoenn? Fine. Why add a fucking desert and a volcano? A volcano that big should put ash in half of the region.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52736977
I think you're severely overestimating exactly how large of a volcano Mt. Chimney is. It is still spewing ash, but is primarily doing so north, towards Route 113. And of course, the desert is surrounded by cliffs and mountains, preventing proper rainfall, which is what a desert is. All of this is plenty logical.

If you mean why Gamefreak added those things, it was likely to play into the themes and new features of the region. They can show weather in the overworld, the box legendaries are all about weather, and having spots like a volcano and desert add contrast with the dichotomy of land vs. sea that the game tries to establish.
Again, nothing you've said is establishing what part of this is illogical. It seems more like you're just seething over the fact that volcanoes can exist without destroying everything and deserts form where rain doesn't fall.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52736977
Everything except the ice caves and the active sand storm in the desert can be found on a single tropical island. The biggest flaw as far as placement goes is that the volcano and density of the forests indicate the general wind direction is to the north/northwest, so the desert should be considerably larger and extend into the area with sootfall, instead of just existing to the east. Otherwise hoenn is a pretty well designed region with all of its biomes in a reasonably logical place. I think you can point out hoenn as the beginning of them deciding to increase available biomes which is totally valid, but it doesn't start feeling like a biome checklist until unova imo.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Remember Sun and Moon. Remember how it supported the entire national dex at the time? Now remember that meant that with its regional dex of 300 Pokemon, it had 400+ Pokemon that it had legacy support for.

Consider that the vast majority of your audience will not ever see those legacy Pokemon in their game. Most play the game and maybe finish the story and then leave it at that. I say this as someone who plays post-game with transfer mons specifically - most people don't care. It's a much smaller fraction that specifically want to bring back older mons continuously.

Now consider that every single possible feature you want to add that interacts with their existing models and animations, and needs to potentially consider every possible Pokemon and every fringe case with those Pokemon.

At some point it becomes prohibitive and even with model and asset reuse. It's simply too much bloat that not enough of your audience gives a shit about.

There's a term for this in development called "Feature Bloat", and no amount of money or time can ultimately answer too much feature bloat.

I literally said I do care about it in that post you absolute 0 IQ retard. Fucking read.

It's not about whether you or I care about it. It's that most people don't care about it. If 90% of the people who buy a Pokemon game have no chance of interacting with more than half the Pokemon coded in and made to support every new feature, then you're literally wasting development time. It doesn't make sense to have to work with 800, 900 or 1,000 of these things when most of your audience could only feasibly interact with 300 to 400 of them in a typical playthrough, at best.

Also feature bloat is still a thing even with asset reuse. You still need to actually apply any new visual effect, any new mechanic, any new animation, to every single Pokemon in the game.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52733572
>+1000 of models
They've been using the same models for some time though. Just import the old ones and you're fine.

>all have to interact a move of some form
Move lists can be left alone. TM/TR/Move Tutor can be automatically assigned by adding some useful categories (mostly types, but also tag Pokemon that have wings, horns, fists, etc). Time consuming the first time you do it, but after that it's just a matter of running a script.

>mega, z move, bara mode
They keep cutting these.

>shiny, variant
Just color changes. Trivial.

>add animation, ranging from idle to moving around
This is difficult, but Gen 6 did most of this with Amie and Gen 7 had cut follower Pokemon to help fill in gaps. Gen 8's choice is still somewhat forgivable, but Gen 9 doesn't have this excuse because Gen 8 did almost all of the work for it.

>add in all stats
Just numbers that don't need to change. Simple to import.

>model icon for menu
A graphic that doesn't need to change. Simple to import.

>add in pokedex
A text string that doesn't need to change. Simple to import.

>add in all cries
A sound file that doesn't need to change.

>all of this in 3d
This is redundant because you said "models".

Gen VI could have had an excuse if it had skimped out on what it was doing, but it didn't. Gen VIII's not getting every Pokemon back in by the end is a bit lame, but I can forgive them not starting with everything from the start. Gen IX still having these problems is lame, and the people who use the "Oh it's so difficult!" excuse are blatantly ignorant of how programming works and how much of the work Game Freak has already done at this time.
